intro: Potentilla verna filiformis, commonly known as the slender mountain cinquefoil, is a low-growing perennial plant native to alpine and subalpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm and has trifoliate or palmate leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and mountainous areas. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
